name: BikeSnitch
body:
![](https://fbcdn-sphotos-h-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xpf1/t31.0-8/p240x240/10547852_10202937006976258_3323256318552739983_o.jpg)

***


## Our Goal  
  
Bike theft has been a large public crime, especially on UC campuses. For our project we will be designing a bike lock that integrates Bluetooth connectivity, GPS tracking, and a renewable power source. Our projectâ€™s goal is to reduce the crime rate of stolen bicycles by preventing and locating them.  
  
## The Team
**Raul Madrigal Jr**: Computer Engineer, Team Captain    
Bluetooth Subsystem Design and Integration Engineer  
    
**Juan Meza**: Electrical Engineer, Team Member    
Power Subsystem Design and Integration Engineer  
   
**Davis Vang**: Computer Engineer, Team Member    
GPS Subsystem Design and Integration Engineer     
   
  
## Senior Design Advisor:  
Professor Pai Chou  
   
   
## UCI Special Design  
* Bluetooth Proximity Detection  
* 100 % Self- Powered  
* Device Focused on Bike Recovery  
  
## Tentative Schedule  
**January 4, 2015:**  
* Assess the overall design and how parts will be integrated onto the bike for part ordering  
* Order needed parts by end of the week  
* Gather data on crime rates for stolen and lost bikes  

**January 11, 2015:**  
* Make sure all parts are delivered and received  
* Assemble and review design overview in order to make any necessary changes  
* Review module of electrical components   

**January 18, 2015:**  
* Start programming and designing the software  
* Have working prototypes of key elements: generator, bluetooth, and GPS tracker  

**January 25, 2015:**  
* Integrate working prototypes to work together
  
**February 1, 2015:**  
* Measure maximum energy storage  
* Measure the power consumption and battery life of prototype  
* Make changes if necessary based on measurements  
* Report data based on measurements  
  
**February 8, 2015:**  
* Debugging and optimization  
  
**February 15, 2015:**  
* Continue debugging and optimization process 
 
**February 22, 2015:**  
* Use case testing and report results  

**March 1, 2015:**  
* Debug and make final preparations for final submissions 
 
**March 8, 2015:**  
* Presentation to panel  
* Submit final report  
  
## Updates
Put Finished Pictures Here  
  
***

### A UCI Senior Design Idea By:  
Raul Madrigal Jr.   
Juan Meza   
Davis Vang
